meta.name: title
meta.content: Manson Northwest Webster School District - Manson & Barnum, Iowa
Manson Northwest Webster School District - Manson & Barnum, Iowa
Manson Northwest Webster School District - Manson & Barnum, Iowa

meta.name: description
meta.content: Official website for the Manson Northwest Webster School District located in Manson and Barnum, Iowa. Elementary, Junior High and High School. We, the Manson Northwest Webster Community School District, believe our goal is to foster a community of caring, cooperative, and involved citizens. To serve this community, we will establish a safe, disciplined environment, providing a positive place to learn.

Official website for the Manson Northwest Webster School District located in Manson and Barnum, Iowa. Elementary, Junior High and High School. We, the Manson Northwest Webster Community School District, believe our goal is to foster a community of caring, cooperative, and involved citizens. To serve this community, we will establish a safe, disciplined environment, providing a positive place to learn.

Official website for the Manson Northwest Webster School District located in Manson and Barnum, Iowa. Elementary, Junior High and High School. We, the Manson Northwest Webster Community School District, believe our goal is to foster a community of caring, cooperative, and involved citizens. To serve this community, we will establish a safe, disciplined environment, providing a positive place to learn.

div.a: FCCLA (Family, Career and Community Leaders of America)
Slider with Basics Page with Sidebar

font.b: We Care. We Inspire. We Empower.

div.span: The school year calendar is accurate on the first day of school. For updates, refer to the Events calendar. (above).

div.b: MNW Students Raise Money for Almost Home

div.span: Four MNW sixth graders created a website to showcase the needs of Almost Home Animal Shelter in Fort Dodge and raised over $1,000 for the shelter. See their website here.

div.font: Our school district is working with Calhoun and Webster County Health to monitor the current and
ever-changing information regarding the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19). We are following all guidelines put out by the CDC and IDPH. Please click on the links below for the most current information.

font.a: March 16, 2020 Letter on COVID-19 and school closing from Superintendent Daggett

div.a: Iowa Department of Public Health - Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)
Center for Disease Control - Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19)

div.span: Here is the Board-approved calendar for the 2020-21 school year (approved 3-19-20).

Seniors, here is some information and guidance surrounding what you should be doing as you prepare for the next stage of your life. You will find important dates for testing, FAFSA information, scholarship information, resume, college reps, colleges visits, and what to do if you want to request early graduation. Questions? Contact Mr. Anliker at 712-469-2245 or by email.

div.b: Application for Free and Reduced Meals

div.span: Children need healthy meals to learn. MNW Schools offer healthy meals every school day. Your child may qualify for free or reduced-priced meals. Parents and guardians may apply at any time (even after the school year has begun) by filling out
and returning it to one of the school offices.

font.span: Here is the updated fee schedule for the 2019-2020 school year.

div.b: Annual Report to the Community Available

div.span: Manson Northwest Webster's annual report to the community is a summary of the 2017-2018 school year. It includes the results of goals, assessments and other locally-determined factors of student success. In addition, there is information about graduation, community connections, as well as highlights at both buildings. See the new report here.

div.font: If you have pictures you'd like to share for the website, please email csturgeon@manson-nw.k12.ia.us.

div.span: Have you heard of MNW's 1,000 Books Before Kindergarten program? Watch
, and read more about it on our page
Go to www.mnwcougars.com/alumni/ to see photos from the last century - and the one before that! - of Manson High School graduates. Also find this on the website under the District/Alumni tab.

div.b: Have an Announcement for the Website?

div.span: Email Christine Sturgeon at csturgeon@manson-nw.k12.ia.us if you have something to share or you find any dead or wrong links on the website.

b.a: MNW Makes Character, Hard Work, and Responsibility Fun

div.span: The Manson Northwest Webster High School offers career and technical programs in the following service areas:

b.font: PreK12 Vision for Teaching and Learning

font.div: Manson Northwest Webster staff will actively engage all students in real-world, relevant, and academically challenging experiences in a safe and positive environment. Staff will share accountability for the learning of all students through professional collaboration, innovative thinking, and the use of technology and research-based strategies.

br.br: It is the policy of Manson Northwest Webster Community School District not to illegally discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints or discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the district's Equity Coordinator, Jeff Anliker, High School Guidance Counselor, 1601 15th Street, 712-469-2245, janliker@manson-nw.k12.ia.us.

div.font: Designed by Kirksville Web Design on Google Sites
